intro: Aconitum glandulosum, commonly known as the glandular monkshood, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features striking blue to purple flowers arranged in a helmet-like shape, typical of the Ranunculaceae family. The plant has dark green, deeply lobed leaves with a rough, hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Aconitum glandulosum contains toxic alkaloids, making it potentially harmful to humans and animals.
